text: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
author: Epictetus

text: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
author: Epictetus

text: Man is not worried by real problems so much as by his imagined anxieties about real problems
author: Epictetus

text: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power or our will.
author: Epictetus

text: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
author: Epictetus

text: First say to yourself what you would be;and then do what you have to do.
author: Epictetus

text: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.
author: Epictetus

text: It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows.
author: Epictetus

text: The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best.
author: Epictetus

text: You are a little soul carrying about a corpse, as Epictetus used to say.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.
author: Epictetus

text: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.
author: Epictetus

text: Circumstances don't make the man, they only reveal him to himself.
author: Epictetus

text: People are not disturbed by things, but by the views they take of them.
author: Epictetus

text: Only the educated are free.
author: Epictetus

text: You are a little soul carrying around a corpse
author: Epictetus

text: First learn the meaning of what you say, and then speak.
author: Epictetus

text: No man is free who is not master of himself.
author: Epictetus

text: Nature hath given men one tongue but two ears, that we may hear from others twice as much as we speak.
author: Epictetus

text: He is a wise man who does not grieve for the things which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has.
author: Epictetus

text: Seek not the good in external things;seek it in yourselves.
author: Epictetus

text: Don't seek to have events happen as you wish, but wish them to happen as they do happen, and all will be well with you.
author: Epictetus

text: Do not try to seem wise to others.
author: Epictetus

text: You become what you give your attention to.
author: Epictetus

text: Small-minded people blame others. Average people blame themselves. The wise see all blame as foolishness
author: Epictetus

text: Know, first, who you are, and then adorn yourself accordingly.
author: Epictetus

text: If evil be said of thee, and if it be true, correct thyself; if it be a lie, laugh at it.
author: Epictetus

text: A ship should not ride on a single anchor, nor life on a singlehope
author: Epictetus

text: Preach not to others what they should eat, but eat as becomes you and be silent.
author: Epictetus

text: you must be ready to burn yourself in your own flame;how could you rise anew if you have not first become ashes?
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: A casual stroll through the lunatic asylum shows that faith does not prove anything.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: We have art in order not to die of the truth.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: There are no beautiful surfaces without a terrible depth.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: All truly great thoughts are conceived while walking.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Be careful, lest in casting out your demon you exorcise the best thing in you.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: There are two different types of people in the world, those who want to know, and those who want to believe.
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

text: Silence is worse; all truths that are kept silent become poisonous.
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

text: One ought to hold on to one's heart; for if one lets it go, one soon loses control of the head too.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: One must still have chaos in oneself to be able to give birth to a dancing star.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: A good writer possesses not only his own spirit but also the spirit of his friends.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: In truth,there was only one christian and he died on the cross.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: All I need is a sheet of paperand something to write with, and thenI can turn the world upside down.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Think lightly of yourself and deeply of the world
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: You must understand that there is more than one path to the top of the mountain
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: Do nothing that is of no use
author: Musashi Miyamoto

text: If you wish to control others you must first control yourself
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: The ultimate aim of martial arts is not having to use them
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: You can only fight the way you practice
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: from one thing, know ten thousand things
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: Today is victory over yourself of yesterday; tomorrow is your victory over lesser men.
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: It is difficult to understand the universe if you only study one planet
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: Perceive that which cannot be seen with the eye.
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: Get beyond love and grief: exist for the good of Man.
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: Do not regret what you have done
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: All man are the same except for their belief in their own selves, regardless of what others may think of them
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: If you know the way broadly you will see it in everything.
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: In battle, if you you make your opponent flinch, you have already won.
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: If you do not control the enemy, the enemy will control you
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: To know ten thousand things, know one well
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: The only reason a warrior is alive is to fight, and the only reason a warrior fights is to win
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: The important thing in strategy is to suppress the enemy's useful actions but allow his useless actions
author: Miyamoto Musashi

text: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca

text: I guess this is a bad time to mention I hung a dummy and painted Seneca Crane's name on it...
author: Suzanne Collins

text: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

text: Non est ad astra mollis e terris via" - "There is no easy way from the earth to the stars
author: Seneca

text: Religion is regarded by the common people as true, by the wise as false, and by rulers as useful.
author: Seneca

text: All cruelty springs from weakness.
author: Seneca

text: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

text: You act like mortals in all that you fear, and like immortals in all that you desire
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

text: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.
author: Seneca the Younger

text: As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.
author: Seneca

text: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
author: Seneca

text: Hang on to your youthful enthusiasms -- you’ll be able to use them better when you’re older.
author: Seneca

text: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.
author: Seneca

text: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
author: Seneca

text: He who is brave is free
author: Seneca

text: What need is there to weep over parts of life? The whole of it calls for tears.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

text: No man was ever wise by chance
author: Seneca

text: They lose the day in expectation of the night, and the night in fear of the dawn.
author: Seneca

text: He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary.
author: Seneca

text: Do one thing at a Time, and while doing it put your whole Soul into it to the exclusion of all else.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: All differences in this world are of degree, and not of kind, because oneness is the secret of everything.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: beleive in yourself and the world will be at your feet
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: The world is the great gymnasium where we come to make ourselves strong.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: Education is the manifestation of perfection already existing in man.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: The whole life is a succession of dreams. My ambition is to be a conscious dreamer, that is all.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: Take Risks in Your Life If u Win, U Can Lead! If u Lose, U Can Guide!
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: The greatest truths are the simplest things in the world, simple as your own existence.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: Desire, ignorance, and inequality—this is the trinity of bondage.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: Where can we go to find God if we cannot see Him in our own hearts and in every living being.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: The very reason for nature's existence is for the education of the soul.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: Things do not grow better; they remain as they are. It is we who grow better, by the changes we make in ourselves.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: You must worship the Self in Krishna, not Krishna as Krishna.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: The powers of the mind are like the rays of the sun when they are concentrated they illumine.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: The cheerful mind perseveres and the strong mind hews its way through a thousand difficulties.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: Blessed are they whose bodies get destroyed in the service of others.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: Devotion to duty is the highest form of worship of God.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: Man conquers the world by conquering himself.
author: Zeno of Citium

text: Well-being is attained little by little, and nevertheless is no little thing itself.
author: Zeno of Citium

text: All the good are friends of one another.
author: Zeno of Citium

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: Wheresoever you go, go with all your heart.
author: Confucius

text: He who knows all the answers has not been asked all the questions.
author: Confucius

text: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: Confucius

text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

text: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

text: If you make a mistake and do not correct it, this is called a mistake.
author: Confucius

text: Study the past if you would define the future.
author: Confucius

text: Before you embark on a journey of revenge, dig two graves.
author: Confucius

text: The funniest people are the saddest ones
author: Confucius

text: To be wronged is nothing, unless you continue to remember it.
author: Confucius

text: The man who asks a question is a fool for a minute, the man who does not ask is a fool for life.
author: Confucius

text: Respect yourself and others will respect you.
author: Confucius

text: Attack the evil that is within yourself, rather than attacking the evil that is in others.
author: Confucius

text: Silence is a true friend who never betrays.
author: Confucius

text: You cannot open a book without learning something.
author: Confucius

text: What the superior man seeks is in himself; what the small man seeks is in others.
author: Confucius

text: People who say it cannot be done should not interrupt those who are doing it.
author: Puck Magazine

text: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
author: Confucius

text: We have two lives, and the second begins when we realize we only have one.
author: Confucius

text: The hardest thing of all is to find a black cat in a dark room, especially if there is no cat.
author: Confucius

text: Music produces a kind of pleasure which human nature cannot do without.
author: Confucius

text: The gem cannot be polished without friction, nor man perfected without trials.
author: Confucius

text: Set thy heart upon thy work, but never on its reward.
author: Ved Vyasa

text: We behold what we are, and we are what we behold.
author: Ved Vyasa

text: Perform all work carefully, guided by compassion.
author: Ved Vyasa

text: O Krishna, the mind is restless
author: Ved Vyasa

text: Selfish action imprisons the world. Act selflessly, without any thought of personal profit.
author: Ved Vyasa

text: Reshape yourself through the power of your will; never let yourself be degraded by self-will.
author: Ved Vyasa

text: Lust, anger, and greed are the three doors to hell
author: Ved Vyasa

text: The wise unify their consciousness and abandon attachment to the fruits of action,
author: Ved Vyasa

text: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.
author: Lao Tzu

text: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everyone will respect you.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The truth is not always beautiful, nor beautiful words the truth.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Time is a created thing. To say 'I don't have time,' is like saying, 'I don't want to.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The best fighter is never angry.
author: Lao Tzu

text: A man with outward courage dares to die; a man with inner courage dares to live.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Care about what other people think and you will always be their prisoner.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Lao Tzu

text: At the center of your beingyou have the answer;you know who you areand you know what you want.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Do you have the patience to wait until your mud settles and the water is clear?
author: Lao Tzu

text: Silence is a source of Great Strength.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The flame that burns Twice as bright burns half as long.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Stop thinking, and end your problems.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
author: Lao-Tzu

text: Manifest plainness,Embrace simplicity,Reduce selfishness,Have few desires.
